intro: Sida californica, commonly known as California sida, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in dry, sandy soils along coastal areas. The plant features small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are lance-shaped with hairy surfaces. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Sida californica is often used in restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soils and provide habitat for native wildlife.
